domains.title: Blockchain
domains.description: Blockchain is a distributed, immutable ledger technology that facilitates secure and transparent transactions. It's the foundational technology for cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and enables decentralized applications (dApps) and new economic systems (DeFi, NFTs).

topics.title: Blockchain & Crypto Fundamentals
topics.summary: Understand the core problem blockchain solves. Learn about ledgers, decentralization, and the cryptographic principles of hashing (SHA-256) and public/private keys.

projects.title: Create a Hash
projects.desc: Use a simple online SHA-256 generator to see how changing one letter in a word completely changes the hash.

topics.title: Core Concepts: Consensus & Mining
topics.summary: Learn how a decentralized network agrees on 'the truth.' Understand distributed ledgers, blocks, chains, and consensus mechanisms like Proof-of-Work (PoW) and Proof-of-Stake (PoS).

freeResources.title: What is a Consensus Algorithm? (Binance Academy)

projects.title: Build a Simple Blockchain
projects.desc: Follow a tutorial to build a very simple blockchain in Python or JavaScript to understand how blocks link.

topics.title: Ethereum & Smart Contracts
topics.summary: Explore Ethereum: the programmable blockchain. Understand the concept of Smart Contracts, the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), gas, and 'Turing-completeness.'

freeResources.title: What is a Smart Contract? (Ethereum Docs)

projects.title: Analyze a Smart Contract
projects.desc: Use a block explorer like Etherscan to find and read the code of a popular smart contract (e.g., a simple token).

organizations.name: Ethereum Foundation
organizations.desc: Non-profit supporting Ethereum and related tech

topics.title: Smart Contract Development (Solidity)
topics.summary: Learn to write smart contracts using Solidity. Understand variables, functions, modifiers, and the ERC-20 token standard. Use tools like Remix IDE.

projects.title: Simple Storage Contract
projects.desc: Write a contract in Remix that can store a number and has functions to set and retrieve it.

projects.title: Create a Simple ERC-20 Token
projects.desc: Use an OpenZeppelin wizard to create a basic, secure ERC-20 token contract.

organizations.name: OpenZeppelin
organizations.desc: Provides security standards for smart contracts

topics.title: dApp Development (Web3)
topics.summary: Learn to build a decentralized application (dApp). Connect a frontend (React) to your smart contract using libraries like Ethers.js or Web3.js and a wallet like MetaMask.

projects.title: Simple dApp
projects.desc: Create a simple web page (React) that connects to MetaMask and reads the number from your 'Simple Storage' contract.

organizations.name: Alchemy
organizations.desc: A leading provider of blockchain node infrastructure

organizations.name: Infura
organizations.desc: A provider of blockchain node infrastructure

topics.title: Blockchain Tooling (Truffle/Hardhat)
topics.summary: Move beyond Remix to professional development environments. Learn to compile, test, and deploy contracts using local development frameworks like Hardhat or Truffle.

projects.title: Test Your Contract
projects.desc: Use Hardhat or Truffle to write automated tests for your ERC-20 token contract.

topics.title: Decentralized Finance (DeFi)
topics.summary: Explore the 'money legos' of crypto. Understand key DeFi protocols like Decentralized Exchanges (DEXs like Uniswap), and lending/borrowing platforms (Aave, Compound).

paidResources.title: DeFi and the Future of Finance (Coursera - Duke)

projects.title: Use a DeFi Protocol
projects.desc: Use a testnet (e.g., Sepolia) to swap two test tokens on Uniswap or borrow a test asset on Aave.

organizations.name: Aave
organizations.desc: A leading lending and borrowing protocol

topics.title: NFTs (Non-Fungible Tokens)
topics.summary: Understand unique digital assets. Learn about the ERC-721 and ERC-1155 token standards, NFT marketplaces (OpenSea), and use cases for digital art and collectibles.

projects.title: Create your own NFT
projects.desc: Follow a tutorial to write and deploy your own ERC-721 contract and mint an NFT on a testnet.

topics.title: Scalability & Layer 2 Solutions
topics.summary: Learn how to make blockchains faster and cheaper. Understand the 'Blockchain Trilemma,' Layer 2 (L2) scaling solutions, rollups (Optimistic/ZK-Rollups), and sidechains.

projects.title: Bridge to a Layer 2
projects.desc: Use a bridge to move test Ether from a testnet (e.g., Sepolia) to a Layer 2 testnet (e.g., Optimism Goerli).

organizations.name: Polygon
organizations.desc: A platform of scaling solutions (Sidechains, ZK)

topics.title: Smart Contract Security
topics.summary: Learn to write secure, immutable code. Understand common attacks like reentrancy, integer overflows, and how to prevent them. Learn about auditing tools and best practices.

projects.title: Beat the Ethernaut
projects.desc: Try to complete the first 3 levels of the Ethernaut wargame.

organizations.name: ConsenSys
organizations.desc: A major blockchain software technology company

organizations.name: Trail of Bits
organizations.desc: A leading blockchain security and auditing firm

domains.title: Cloud Computing
domains.description: Cloud Computing is the on-demand delivery of IT resources—including servers, storage, databases, networking, and software—over the Internet ('the cloud') with pay-as-you-go pricing. It allows companies to innovate faster and be more flexible without managing physical hardware.

topics.title: Introduction to Cloud Computing
topics.summary: Learn the fundamental concepts: What is the cloud? What are the service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and deployment models (Public, Private, Hybrid)?

projects.title: Service Model Analysis
projects.desc: For a given app (e.g., email), describe how you would build it using IaaS vs. PaaS vs. buying it as SaaS.

organizations.name: Google Cloud Platform
organizations.desc: A major cloud provider strong in data/ML

topics.title: Core Compute Services
topics.summary: Learn how to run code in the cloud, from Virtual Machines (VMs) to Containers and Serverless functions.

paidResources.title: A Practical Guide to AWS Lambda (Udemy)

projects.title: Launch a Web Server
projects.desc: Launch a simple 't2.micro' EC2 instance (or Azure VM) and host a static HTML page.

projects.title: Deploy a Serverless Function
projects.desc: Create an AWS Lambda (or Azure Function) that returns 'Hello World' when called.

topics.title: Cloud Storage & Databases
topics.summary: Learn where to store your data. Understand Object Storage (S3, Blob), Block Storage (EBS), and managed SQL (RDS) & NoSQL (DynamoDB) databases.

projects.title: Host a Static Website on S3
projects.desc: Create an S3 bucket, upload your HTML/CSS files, and configure it for static website hosting.

organizations.name: MongoDB
organizations.desc: Popular NoSQL database, offered as a cloud service

topics.title: Cloud Networking
topics.summary: Learn to build your own private network in the cloud. Understand Virtual Private Clouds (VPC/VNet), Subnets, Security Groups, and Load Balancers.

projects.title: Build a 2-Tier VPC
projects.desc: Design a VPC with a public subnet (for a web server) and a private subnet (for a database).

organizations.name: Cloudflare
organizations.desc: Major provider of cloud networking and security services

topics.title: Identity & Access Management (IAM)
topics.summary: Control who can do what in your cloud. Learn about Users, Groups, Roles, Policies, and the Principle of Least Privilege.

projects.title: Create a 'Read-Only' User
projects.desc: Create an IAM policy and user that has read-only access to your S3 buckets, but no write permissions.

topics.title: Cloud Architecture & Design
topics.summary: Learn how to design robust systems. Understand the 'Well-Architected Framework' (Cost, Performance, Security, etc.), High Availability, and Fault Tolerance.

projects.title: Design a High-Availability App
projects.desc: Draw an architecture diagram for a website that can survive one server failing (Hint: use a load balancer and multiple servers).

organizations.name: Gartner
organizations.desc: Analyst firm that defines cloud architecture best practices

topics.title: Cloud Security
topics.summary: Learn to secure your cloud. Understand the 'Shared Responsibility Model', encryption (at-rest/in-transit), key management (KMS), and DDoS protection.

projects.title: Secure an S3 Bucket
projects.desc: Configure an S3 bucket to be fully private, enable server-side encryption, and block all public access.

topics.title: DevOps & Infrastructure as Code
topics.summary: Manage your cloud with code. Learn Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform or CloudFormation, and build CI/CD pipelines.

projects.title: Deploy an S3 Bucket with Terraform
projects.desc: Write a simple Terraform file to create and configure an S3 bucket instead of using the console.

topics.title: Monitoring & Cost Management
topics.summary: Learn to watch your apps and your wallet. Understand logging (CloudWatch, Azure Monitor), create alerts, and use cost calculators & budgets.

projects.title: Create a Billing Alert
projects.desc: Set up a billing alert in AWS or Azure to notify you via email if your spending is projected to exceed $10.

organizations.name: Splunk
organizations.desc: A leading platform for log analysis

topics.title: Certifications & Careers
topics.summary: Plan your career. Learn the certification paths for AWS, Azure, and GCP, and understand roles like Cloud Engineer, Solutions Architect, and DevOps Engineer.

projects.title: Build Your Career Plan
projects.desc: Choose one cloud platform (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and map out the first two certifications you would take.

organizations.name: A Cloud Guru
organizations.desc: Popular platform for cloud certification training

domains.title: Cybersecurity
domains.description: Cybersecurity protects systems, networks, and data from digital threats. It combines technology, processes, and human expertise to prevent attacks, detect breaches, and ensure data integrity. The field spans areas such as ethical hacking, forensics, SIEM, and cloud security.

topics.title: Introduction to Cybersecurity
topics.summary: Get a complete overview of the cybersecurity landscape — its importance, threats, goals, and career paths.

paidResources.title: Coursera — Introduction to Cybersecurity by NYU

projects.title: Cyber Threat Report
projects.desc: Research and summarize top global cyber threats of the past year.

topics.title: Networking Fundamentals
topics.summary: Learn how data travels through networks, key protocols, and how attackers exploit network weaknesses.

projects.title: Packet Sniffer using Python
projects.desc: Capture and analyze network packets using Scapy or Wireshark.

organizations.name: Cisco
organizations.desc: Global leader in networking and network security

topics.title: Linux for Security
topics.summary: Linux is the backbone of cybersecurity. Learn essential commands, file permissions, and server hardening.

projects.title: Bash Script for Log Monitoring
projects.desc: Automate security log monitoring using Bash and grep.

organizations.name: Kali Linux
organizations.desc: Popular OS for penetration testing and forensics

topics.title: Cryptography
topics.summary: Understand the science of securing communication through encryption, hashing, and key management.

projects.title: RSA Encryption Tool
projects.desc: Implement RSA encryption and decryption in Python.

projects.title: File Integrity Checker
projects.desc: Verify file integrity using SHA256 hashing.

organizations.name: OWASP
organizations.desc: Provides cryptography best practices for web apps

topics.title: Web Application Security
topics.summary: Explore vulnerabilities like SQL Injection, XSS, and CSRF, and learn to protect web applications using OWASP guidelines.

projects.title: Vulnerable Web App Lab
projects.desc: Setup and exploit DVWA to practice real-world attacks.

organizations.name: OWASP
organizations.desc: Global non-profit focused on web security awareness

topics.title: Ethical Hacking & PenTesting
topics.summary: Learn to ethically find and exploit vulnerabilities in systems to strengthen their defenses.

projects.title: Vulnerability Assessment Report
projects.desc: Scan a test network using Nmap and prepare an assessment report.

organizations.name: Offensive Security
organizations.desc: Creators of Kali Linux and OSCP certification

topics.title: Incident Response & Digital Forensics
topics.summary: Learn how to respond to security incidents and analyze digital evidence using forensic tools.

projects.title: Log-based Intrusion Detection
projects.desc: Create a script to detect anomalies in system logs.

organizations.name: SANS Institute
organizations.desc: Global leader in digital forensics training

topics.title: Cloud & Network Security
topics.summary: Protect cloud-based infrastructure and network environments using modern tools and policies.

projects.title: Secure AWS Environment
projects.desc: Set up IAM roles, security groups, and monitor logs for a cloud instance.

organizations.name: AWS Security
organizations.desc: Offers security best practices for cloud users

topics.title: SIEM & Log Analysis
topics.summary: Understand how Security Information and Event Management tools help detect and analyze threats in real time.

freeResources.title: ELK Stack Tutorial for Beginners (YouTube - Tech TFQ)

projects.title: SIEM Log Dashboard
projects.desc: Build a log visualization dashboard using the ELK Stack.

organizations.name: Splunk
organizations.desc: Leading SIEM platform for log analysis

topics.title: Certifications & Career Prep
topics.summary: Plan your career path with key certifications, skill-building resources, and interview prep guides.

projects.title: Cybersecurity Resume + Portfolio
projects.desc: Create a professional cybersecurity portfolio with GitHub projects and certifications.

organizations.name: (ISC)²
organizations.desc: Provides CISSP and other global cybersecurity certifications

organizations.name: CompTIA
organizations.desc: Offers Security+, Network+, and related certifications

domains.title: Data Science
domains.description: Data Science is an interdisciplinary field that uses scientific methods, processes, algorithms, and systems to extract knowledge and insights from structured and unstructured data. It combines statistics, data analysis, machine learning, and business domain knowledge to turn raw data into actionable insights.

topics.title: Foundations of Data Science
topics.summary: Understand the data science lifecycle: asking the right questions, data collection, data wrangling, exploratory data analysis (EDA), modeling, and communication.

projects.title: Kaggle Dataset Exploration
projects.desc: Pick a simple dataset from Kaggle (like the Titanic) and write down the questions you would try to answer.

organizations.name: Kaggle
organizations.desc: The world's largest data science community

topics.title: Statistics & Probability
topics.summary: Master the core of data analysis. Learn descriptive statistics (mean, median, mode), inferential statistics, hypothesis testing (A/B testing), and core probability concepts.

projects.title: A/B Test Analysis
projects.desc: Given a sample A/B test dataset, determine if the new version is a statistically significant improvement.

topics.title: Programming for Data (Python/R)
topics.summary: Learn the tools to manipulate data. Master Python (with Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib) or R (with dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2).

freeResources.title: R for Data Science (Book - Free Online)

projects.title: Analyze a CSV with Pandas
projects.desc: Use Pandas to load a CSV, find the min/max/mean of a column, and filter for specific values.

topics.title: Data Wrangling & Cleaning
topics.summary: The most important job. Learn to handle missing values, correct data types, merge and join datasets, and reshape data into a 'tidy' format.

paidResources.title: Data Wrangling, Analysis, and AB Testing (Udemy)

projects.title: Clean a 'Dirty' Dataset
projects.desc: Find a messy dataset online and write a script to clean it (impute missing values, fix formats, remove duplicates).

topics.title: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
topics.summary: Get to know your data. Learn to use statistics and visualizations to find patterns, identify anomalies, and formulate hypotheses.

projects.title: Titanic EDA
projects.desc: Perform a full EDA on the Titanic dataset. Find correlations (e.g., class vs. survival) and visualize them.

organizations.name: Kaggle
organizations.desc: Hosts thousands of public notebooks with EDA

topics.title: Data Visualization
topics.summary: Learn to tell a story with data. Master libraries (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly) for code-based charts and BI tools (Tableau, Power BI) for dashboards.

projects.title: Build an Interactive Dashboard
projects.desc: Use Tableau Public or Power BI to create a dashboard for a dataset of your choice.

topics.title: Machine Learning
topics.summary: Learn to make predictions. Understand Supervised (Regression, Classification) and Unsupervised (Clustering) models. Use Scikit-learn to train and evaluate models.

projects.title: House Price Prediction
projects.desc: Use Scikit-learn to build a linear regression model to predict house prices from a dataset.

organizations.name: Scikit-learn
organizations.desc: The foundational ML library for Python

topics.title: Big Data & SQL
topics.summary: Learn to get data from databases. Master SQL (SELECT, JOIN, GROUP BY). Understand Big Data concepts (Hadoop, Spark) and cloud data warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery).

projects.title: Analyze a Database
projects.desc: Download a sample SQL database (e.g., Chinook) and write queries to answer business questions.

topics.title: Data Ethics & Communication
topics.summary: The most crucial step. Learn to present your findings as a compelling story. Understand data ethics, privacy, and how to avoid bias in your models and conclusions.

projects.title: Create a Project Presentation
projects.desc: Take your EDA project and create a 5-slide presentation for a non-technical audience.

organizations.name: Data for Good
organizations.desc: Movement for using data in the social sector

topics.title: Deployment & MLOps (Basics)
topics.summary: Put your model to work. Learn to save your model (pickle/joblib), wrap it in an API (FastAPI, Flask), and containerize it (Docker).

projects.title: Deploy a Model API
projects.desc: Wrap your house price model in a FastAPI file so it can make predictions from API calls.

domains.title: DevOps
domains.description: DevOps is a culture and set of practices that combines software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops) to shorten the software development life cycle. It emphasizes automation, collaboration, and monitoring to build, test, and release software faster and more reliably.

topics.title: Foundations: Linux & Scripting
topics.summary: The bedrock of DevOps. Master the Linux command line, file systems, permissions, and shell scripting (Bash) to automate tasks.

projects.title: Automation Script
projects.desc: Write a Bash script that backs up a directory and deletes backups older than 7 days.

projects.title: Setup a Web Server
projects.desc: Manually install and configure an Nginx web server on a Linux VM.

topics.title: Git & Source Code Management
topics.summary: Master version control. Go beyond 'commit' and 'push' to learn branching strategies (GitFlow), merging, rebasing, and managing pull requests (PRs).

projects.title: Fix a Merge Conflict
projects.desc: Intentionally create and then resolve a merge conflict between two branches.

organizations.name: GitHub
organizations.desc: The world's largest code hosting platform

topics.title: CI/CD Pipelines
topics.summary: The 'automation engine' of DevOps. Learn Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) principles. Build pipelines with tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or GitLab CI.

projects.title: Simple CI Pipeline
projects.desc: Create a GitHub Action that automatically runs 'npm install' and 'npm test' on every push.

topics.title: Containerization (Docker)
topics.summary: Package your applications. Learn to create, manage, and run lightweight, portable containers using Docker. Master Dockerfiles, Docker Compose, and image registries.

projects.title: Dockerize an Application
projects.desc: Write a Dockerfile for a simple web app (e.g., Node.js or Python) and build the image.

projects.title: Docker Compose Stack
projects.desc: Use Docker Compose to launch your web app and a database (e.g., Postgres) with one command.

organizations.name: Docker
organizations.desc: The company behind the container platform

topics.title: Container Orchestration (Kubernetes)
topics.summary: Manage containers at scale. Learn the complex but powerful Kubernetes (k8s) ecosystem. Understand Pods, Services, Deployments, ConfigMaps, and Helm charts.

projects.title: Deploy a k8s App
projects.desc: Use Minikube (local k8s) to deploy your Dockerized app using a Deployment and expose it with a Service.

topics.title: Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
topics.summary: Manage infrastructure with code. Learn to provision and manage servers, databases, and networks using code. Master Terraform (declarative) and Ansible (procedural).

projects.title: Provision AWS S3 with Terraform
projects.desc: Write a Terraform file to create an S3 bucket and an IAM user with access to it.

projects.title: Configure Nginx with Ansible
projects.desc: Write an Ansible playbook to install, configure, and start Nginx on a VM.

topics.title: Monitoring & Observability
topics.summary: If you can't see it, you can't fix it. Learn to collect metrics (Prometheus), visualize them (Grafana), and manage logs (ELK Stack/Loki). Understand the 3 pillars: Metrics, Logs, Traces.

projects.title: Prometheus+Grafana
projects.desc: Install Prometheus and Grafana, scrape metrics from a simple app, and build a dashboard.

topics.title: Cloud Platform (AWS, Azure, GCP)
topics.summary: Master the platform where everything runs. Learn the core services of one major cloud provider (e.g., AWS: EC2, S3, VPC, IAM, RDS) and their managed DevOps services.

projects.title: Full Cloud-Native Pipeline
projects.desc: Use AWS CodePipeline (or Azure DevOps) to build and deploy a containerized app to a managed service (EKS/AKS or ECS/ACI).

topics.title: Advanced: GitOps & Service Mesh
topics.summary: Move to pro-level. Learn GitOps (using Git as the 'source of truth' for infrastructure) with tools like ArgoCD. Understand Service Mesh (Istio, Linkerd) for managing microservices.

projects.title: ArgoCD Sync
projects.desc: Install ArgoCD on k8s and configure it to automatically sync a 'Hello World' app from a GitHub repo.

topics.title: Advanced: SRE & FinOps
topics.summary: Adopt the 'Pro' mindset. Learn Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) principles (SLOs, SLIs, Error Budgets) from Google. Understand FinOps to manage and optimize cloud costs.

projects.title: Define SLOs/SLIs
projects.desc: For your simple web app, define a Service Level Objective (SLO) (e.g., 99.9% uptime) and a Service Level Indicator (SLI) (e.g., HTTP 200 response rate).

domains.title: Internet of Things (IoT)
domains.description: The Internet of Things (IoT) is a network of interconnected, embedded devices ('things') that collect and share data over the internet. This domain blends hardware engineering, networking, cloud computing, and data analytics to build smart systems, from home thermostats to industrial machinery.

topics.title: Introduction to IoT
topics.summary: Learn the fundamental concepts, architecture (Device -> Gateway -> Cloud -> Application), and real-world applications of IoT in smart homes, cities, and industry.

paidResources.title: Coursera — Introduction to the Internet of Things (UCI)

projects.title: IoT System Design
projects.desc: On paper, diagram the 4-stage architecture for a 'smart refrigerator' (what it senses, how it connects, etc.).

organizations.name: IoT World Today
organizations.desc: News and analysis on the IoT industry

topics.title: IoT Hardware & Sensors
topics.summary: Get hands-on with the 'Things.' Learn about microcontrollers (Arduino, ESP32), single-board computers (Raspberry Pi), sensors (temp, motion, light), and actuators (relays, motors).

projects.title: Blink an LED
projects.desc: The 'Hello World' of hardware: Use an Arduino or ESP32 to make an LED blink.

projects.title: Read a Sensor
projects.desc: Connect a DHT11 sensor to your microcontroller to read temperature and humidity data.

topics.title: IoT Networking & Protocols
topics.summary: Learn how devices communicate. Understand device-level protocols (WiFi, Bluetooth, Zigbee, LoRaWAN) and application-layer protocols (MQTT, CoAP, HTTP).

projects.title: MQTT Publisher/Subscriber
projects.desc: Use an ESP32 to publish your sensor data to a public MQTT broker (like HiveMQ) and subscribe to it with a desktop client.

organizations.name: HiveMQ
organizations.desc: A leading MQTT broker and platform

topics.title: IoT Cloud Platforms
topics.summary: Learn where to send your data. Understand the role of IoT platforms for device management, data ingestion, and security (e.g., AWS IoT Core, Azure IoT Hub, Google Cloud IoT).

projects.title: Connect to AWS IoT Core
projects.desc: Provision your ESP32 as a 'Thing' in AWS IoT Core and securely send your MQTT data to the cloud.

topics.title: Data Processing & Visualization
topics.summary: Make your data useful. Learn to store time-series data (InfluxDB), route it (Node-RED), and build real-time dashboards (Grafana, Databox).

projects.title: Build a Weather Dashboard
projects.desc: Use Node-RED to get your sensor data, store it in InfluxDB, and build a Grafana dashboard to visualize it.

topics.title: Edge Computing
topics.summary: Learn to process data *before* the cloud. Understand the need for edge computing (latency, bandwidth, cost) and tools like AWS Greengrass, Azure IoT Edge, and TinyML.

projects.title: Local MQTT Broker
projects.desc: Install an MQTT broker (like Mosquitto) on a Raspberry Pi to act as a local gateway for your devices.

organizations.name: TinyML Foundation
organizations.desc: Promotes machine learning on edge devices

topics.title: IoT Security
topics.summary: Learn to secure your devices. Understand the IoT attack surface, device hardening, secure boot, network encryption (TLS), and managing device certificates (PKI).

projects.title: Secure your MQTT Broker
projects.desc: Configure your Mosquitto broker to require a username, password, and TLS encryption.

organizations.name: OWASP
organizations.desc: Manages the Top 10 IoT security vulnerabilities

topics.title: Industrial IoT (IIoT)
topics.summary: Explore IoT in industry. Learn about SCADA, PLCs, predictive maintenance, and 'Digital Twins' for manufacturing, logistics, and agriculture.

projects.title: Predictive Maintenance Analysis
projects.desc: Research a case study of how IIoT sensors are used to predict motor failure in a factory.

organizations.name: Siemens
organizations.desc: A leader in industrial automation and IIoT

topics.title: Consumer IoT
topics.summary: Explore IoT for people. Learn about smart home ecosystems (Alexa, Google Home, Apple HomeKit), wearables (Fitbit), and user-centric design.

projects.title: Smart Light Project
projects.desc: Use an ESP32 and a relay to control a lamp by sending an MQTT command from your phone or PC.

organizations.name: Amazon
organizations.desc: Creator of Alexa and the Echo ecosystem

topics.title: IoT Lifecycle & Management
topics.summary: Learn to manage devices at scale. Understand device provisioning, Over-the-Air (OTA) firmware updates, and device fleet management.

projects.title: Perform an OTA Update
projects.desc: Follow a tutorial to update the code on your ESP32 over WiFi instead of using a USB cable.

organizations.name: Espressif
organizations.desc: Creators of the popular ESP32 and ESP8266

domains.title: Machine Learning
domains.description: Machine Learning (ML) is a field of artificial intelligence (AI) that enables computers to learn from data and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed. It involves algorithms that can identify patterns, make predictions, and generate insights from complex datasets.

topics.title: Introduction to ML & AI
topics.summary: Understand the fundamentals of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning, and how they differ.

paidResources.title: Coursera — Machine Learning by Andrew Ng (Stanford)

projects.title: ML Concepts Report
projects.desc: Write a short report explaining the difference between Supervised, Unsupervised, and Reinforcement Learning.

organizations.name: Google AI
organizations.desc: Drives research and development in AI/ML

topics.title: Python for Data Science
topics.summary: Master the essential Python libraries for data manipulation and analysis: NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib.

paidResources.title: Coursera — Python for Data Science, AI & Development (IBM)

projects.title: Analyze a CSV file
projects.desc: Use Pandas to load a CSV, clean it, and calculate descriptive statistics.

organizations.name: Pandas Team
organizations.desc: Maintainers of the open-source Pandas library

topics.title: Math for Machine Learning
topics.summary: Review the core mathematical concepts that power ML algorithms: Linear Algebra, Calculus, and Statistics.

projects.title: Gradient Descent from Scratch
projects.desc: Implement a simple linear regression using only NumPy, calculating gradients manually.

topics.title: Data Preprocessing & EDA
topics.summary: Learn to clean, transform, and visualize data. Handle missing values, encode features, and perform Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA).

paidResources.title: Udemy — Feature Engineering for Machine Learning

projects.title: Titanic Dataset Analysis
projects.desc: Perform a full EDA on the classic Titanic dataset and visualize your findings.

organizations.name: Kaggle
organizations.desc: A platform for data science competitions and datasets

topics.title: Supervised Learning
topics.summary: Build models that predict an output from labeled data. Covers Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, and SVMs.

paidResources.title: Coursera — Supervised ML (Part of Andrew Ng's Spec.)

projects.title: House Price Prediction
projects.desc: Build a Linear Regression model to predict housing prices.

projects.title: Iris Flower Classification
projects.desc: Use a Decision Tree or SVM to classify species of Iris flowers.

organizations.name: Scikit-learn
organizations.desc: The core open-source ML library for Python

topics.title: Unsupervised Learning
topics.summary: Find hidden patterns in unlabeled data using algorithms like K-Means Clustering, DBSCAN, and PCA.

paidResources.title: Coursera — Unsupervised Learning (Part of Andrew Ng's Spec.)

projects.title: Customer Segmentation
projects.desc: Use K-Means to cluster customers from a shopping dataset.

topics.title: Model Evaluation & Metrics
topics.summary: Learn how to tell if your model is good. Understand Accuracy, Precision, Recall, F1-Score, R-Squared, and Cross-Validation.

projects.title: Compare Two Models
projects.desc: Train two different classifiers (e.g., Logistic Regression vs. Random Forest) and write a report on which is better and why, using proper metrics.

organizations.name: Kaggle
organizations.desc: Platform focused on predictive modeling and metrics

topics.title: Introduction to Deep Learning
topics.summary: Explore the basics of Neural Networks and Deep Learning using libraries like TensorFlow and Keras.

projects.title: MNIST Digit Classifier
projects.desc: Build a simple neural network to classify handwritten digits (0-9).

organizations.name: Keras
organizations.desc: A high-level, user-friendly API for deep learning

topics.title: ML Specializations
topics.summary: Get an overview of advanced fields like Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision (CV), and Reinforcement Learning.

projects.title: Simple Sentiment Analysis
projects.desc: Use a pre-trained model (like VADER) to classify text as positive or negative.

projects.title: Object Detection with YOLO
projects.desc: Use a pre-trained YOLO model to detect objects in an image.

organizations.name: Hugging Face
organizations.desc: The leading platform for NLP models and tools

organizations.name: OpenCV
organizations.desc: The core library for open-source computer vision

topics.title: MLOps & Deployment
topics.summary: Learn how to productionize your models. Covers model serving, monitoring, and MLOps principles.

freeResources.title: Building a simple API with FastAPI

projects.title: Deploy Model with FastAPI
projects.desc: Wrap your trained model (e.g., the house price predictor) in a FastAPI endpoint.

projects.title: Dockerize your ML App
projects.desc: Containerize your FastAPI application using Docker.

organizations.name: Kubernetes
organizations.desc: The leading platform for container orchestration

domains.title: Software Development
domains.description: Software Development is the comprehensive process of conceiving, designing, building, testing, and deploying software. It's an engineering discipline that combines computer science, project management, and creative problem-solving to create applications for web, mobile, desktop, and more.

topics.title: SDLC & Agile
topics.summary: Learn the 'how' of building software. Understand the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), from requirements gathering and design to testing and deployment. Master Agile, Scrum, and Kanban.

projects.title: Create a Project Trello Board
projects.desc: Plan a small project (e.g., a blog) using User Stories, a Backlog, and To Do/In Progress/Done columns.

organizations.name: Atlassian
organizations.desc: Creators of Jira and Trello (Agile tools)

topics.title: Software Architecture
topics.summary: Learn to design the 'blueprint' of a system. Understand architectures like Monolith, Microservices, and 3-Tier. Study SOLID principles and common Design Patterns.

projects.title: Diagram a System
projects.desc: Draw a simple component diagram for a ride-sharing app (User, Driver, API, Database, Payments).

topics.title: Data Structures & Algorithms
topics.summary: Master the core tools of programming. Learn Data Structures (Arrays, Maps, Stacks, Trees) and Algorithms (Sorting, Searching) to write efficient, scalable code.

paidResources.title: Book: Cracking the Coding Interview (G.L. McDowell)

projects.title: Solve 10 LeetCode Easy
projects.desc: Solve 10 'Easy' problems on LeetCode using the language of your choice.

topics.title: Version Control (Git)
topics.summary: Learn how to manage and collaborate on code. Master the essentials: commit, push, pull, branch, merge, and handle merge conflicts using Git and GitHub.

projects.title: Create a GitHub Repo
projects.desc: Create a new repo, add a file, create a 'dev' branch, make a change, and merge it back to 'main'.

organizations.name: GitHub
organizations.desc: The world's largest code hosting platform

topics.title: Web Development: Frontend
topics.summary: Build the user-facing part of websites. Master HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, then learn modern frameworks like React, Vue, or Angular to build dynamic user interfaces.

projects.title: Personal Portfolio Website
projects.desc: Build a responsive portfolio website using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

projects.title: React To-Do List
projects.desc: Create a simple To-Do list app where users can add and remove tasks.

topics.title: Web Development: Backend
topics.summary: Build the 'server-side' logic. Learn to create REST APIs, manage databases, and handle user authentication using languages/frameworks like Node.js, Python (Django/FastAPI), or Java (Spring).

freeResources.title: Building a REST API with Express (Guide)

projects.title: Blog API
projects.desc: Create a REST API with endpoints to Create, Read, Update, and Delete blog posts.

topics.title: Mobile App Development
topics.summary: Build applications for iOS and Android. Choose between Native (Swift for iOS, Kotlin for Android) or Cross-Platform (React Native, Flutter) development.

projects.title: Simple Weather App
projects.desc: Build a mobile app in Flutter or React Native that pulls data from a free weather API and displays it.

topics.title: Databases
topics.summary: Learn how to store and retrieve data. Understand relational SQL databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL) and non-relational NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Firestore, Redis).

projects.title: E-commerce Schema
projects.desc: Design the SQL database schema (tables and relationships) for an e-commerce store with Users, Products, and Orders.

topics.title: Testing & Quality Assurance
topics.summary: Ensure your code works. Learn about the 'Testing Pyramid' (Unit, Integration, E2E tests) using tools like Jest, Pytest, or Selenium.

projects.title: Write Unit Tests
projects.desc: For your 'Blog API' project, write unit tests to verify that your 'Create Post' endpoint works correctly.

organizations.name: ISTQB
organizations.desc: Global board for software testing certification

topics.title: DevOps & Deployment
topics.summary: Automate your workflow. Learn to containerize apps with Docker, set up CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions), and deploy to cloud platforms (AWS, Vercel, Heroku).

projects.title: Dockerize your API
projects.desc: Create a Dockerfile for your backend API, build an image, and run it in a container.
